qa.name: Sherlock Bones
qa.appearance: Golden Retriever with a deerstalker hat

json_to_edit.voice_over: In a city where humans couldn't solve the unsolvable, one dog rose to the challenge.
json_to_edit.description: Sherlock Bones investigates a mysterious disappearance at the local park.
json_to_edit.ambience_sound_keywords: Birds chirping, children playing, distant traffic
json_to_edit.name: The Case of the Missing Frisbee
json_to_edit.scene_summary: Sherlock Bones uses his extraordinary senses to solve the mystery of a missing frisbee in the park.

qa.action: A bustling city park on a sunny day, families enjoying picnics and games.

hf.action: Sherlock Bones arrives at the park, his nose twitching as he picks up a scent.

tr.action: Sherlock's nose close to the ground, following an invisible trail.

xc.action: Sherlock zigzags across the park, drawing curious looks from onlookers.

ka.action: We see what Sherlock sees: a colorful frisbee stuck high in a tree.

fn.action: Sherlock looks up at the tree, his tail wagging as he formulates a plan.

af.action: Sherlock barks to get the attention of a nearby park keeper.

qo.action: The park keeper climbs a ladder to retrieve the frisbee while Sherlock watches.

fp.action: A child's hand pats Sherlock's head in gratitude as he wags his tail.

va.action: Sherlock trots proudly through the park, ready for his next case.

edit_command: Remove every second shot from the scene, but don't change anything else.

updated_json.voice_over: In a city where humans couldn't solve the unsolvable, one dog rose to the challenge.

label.rationale: we will remove every second shot from the scene as requested, while keeping all other elements of the json unchanged. this means we'll remove shots with keys "hf", "xc", "fn", "qo", and "va". we'll update the "list_display_order" accordingly and adjust the "number_of_shots" from "10" to "5". all other information in the json will remain the same.
